Title: It Support Administrator
Description: Required Skills & Experience 2–4 years of hands-on IT support experience (desktop, server, and SaaS-based applications) Skilled in troubleshooting hardware, operating systems, software installations, malware removal, and access control Proficient in supporting Windows and Mac OS environments, Microsoft Office applications, and end-user peripherals (printers, scanners, etc.) Familiarity with networking concepts and troubleshooting Strong communication skills for user training and issue escalation Ability to maintain confidentiality and meet deadlines Nice to Have Skills & Experience Strong Plus – Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, or related field (or equivalent experience) Strong Plus – Experience supporting SAP users and/or call center operations Experience with conference room technology and AV equipment Experience with IT equipment deployment and office build-outs Willingness to travel domestically or internationally for support needs Job Description We are seeking a Level 2 IT Support Specialist to provide second-level technical support and assist with the administration of desktop, server, and SaaS-based applications. Title: It Support
Description: Are you passionate about technology and delivering outstanding support experiences? Stanbridge University is looking for a skilled and service-driven End-User Desktop Support Technician to be a key player in our fast-paced and collaborative IT team. In this role, you'll be the frontline hero supporting our faculty, staff, and students—ensuring classrooms run smoothly, solving tech issues with confidence, and deploying modern hardware and software solutions. From setting up AV systems to managing device imaging and distributing essential materials, you'll have a direct impact on the daily success of our campus community. If you're a proactive problem-solver with a love for helping people and a knack for technology, we'd love to meet you. Essential Functions Desktop Support: Install, maintain, clean, and troubleshoot monitors, keyboards, mice, CPUs, printers, and other peripherals Technical Troubleshooting: Provide support for both hardware and software issues, including troubleshooting IP addressing, viruses, system performance, and failing applications Hardware/Software Upgrades: Assist in upgrading software and hardware, including RAM installation and other system enhancements Image Deployment: Deploy new classroom images using Windows Deployment Services (WDS), Microsoft 365, Google Admin, Chrome OS, Zoom, and BOX knowledge. Network Setup: Install and maintain network/phone cables for classrooms and offices and troubleshoot any connectivity issues Support Requests: Respond to incoming calls, emails, and support tickets from faculty, staff, and students seeking assistance with technical problems Qualifications Technical Expertise: Solid experience supporting Windows 10/11 in a business environment, as well as proficiency with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel) Systems Administration: Familiarity with administering Microsoft Active Directory for user and computer accounts Incident Management: Proven ability to manage IT incidents, from initial request through to resolution Hardware & Software Troubleshooting: Previous experience supporting standard desktop and laptop hardware, peripherals, and software issues Hardware Knowledge: Experience with common hardware vendors, including Dell, Lenovo, Chromebooks and others Image Deployment: Experience with Microsoft WDS for deploying Windows images to multiple devices is a plus Certifications: CompTIA A+ and Network+ certifications (or equivalent experience) are highly preferred Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills, with an emphasis on excellent customer service Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment while providing exceptional support to end-users $18-$22/hr. essential functions of this job successfully To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily and be physically present in the office experience required by our accreditors All employment offers are contingent upon completion of a background check Work Environment: Standard office/classroom/lab or clinical setting Typically, duties are performed in an office/classroom/Lab/clinical setting environment while sitting at a desk or computer workstation Work environment may include skills lab or bedside environments as required by Title: It Systems Analyst I
Description: Come launch the next step in your career where America launched its Space Program. Brevard Health Alliance, Brevard County’s only Federally Qualified Health Center, is currently recruiting for a Medical Assistant to join us in the heart of Brevard County’s Space Coast. Since 2005 our focus has been on putting the “community” in Community Health while delivering healthcare to more than 60,000 unique patients annually. Brevard Health Alliance offers competitive salaries, a comprehensive hiring package that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, Short and Long-term Disability Coverage and a 401K with company match, a generous personal leave program, a National Health Service Corps (NHSC) Approved Site for Loan Repayment and Qualified Employer for Public Service Loan Forgiveness, tuition assistance for continuing education, professional development, and the opportunity for upward mobility. We are expanding, we are growing. If you would like the genuine opportunity to make a profound difference in the delivery of primary care and community health, we invite your interest and application after reviewing the specifics and requirements for the Medical Assistant listed below. Position Summary The Information Technology (IT) Systems Analyst I provides superior quality, competitive value, and outstanding service by servicing all organization technologies and providing technology support and training. The IT Systems Analyst’s primary duties include analyzing systems and processes and maintaining workstations and networks. General Education Requirements Minimum of an Associate Degree in Health Care Administration, Computer Science, Business Administration or Information Technology from an accredited educational institution or 3+ years of experience in Information Technology or Technical Support. Additional Qualifications Minimum 3 years of technical or service support experience in Information Technology Experience in gathering data used in the conducting of reports and familiar with medical terminology Proficient in Microsoft Office applications and Health Care Computer applications Strong verbal and written communication skills Detail oriented and strong organizational skills Working knowledge of data center, network infrastructure, O365 and Microsoft Azure Ability to conceptualize and organize project planning process Attention to detail and strong interpersonal skills needed Must be self-directed Ability to take responsibility and function under minimal supervision Excellent written and verbal communication skills Primary Accountabilities Provide Tier 1+ Help Desk support Provide hands-on assistance to IT team members Provides basic and advanced desktop support: Troubleshoots Email, Office Productivity Software Provides support to the Network and Security Administrator on security and/or network issues – lower tier support Trains staff on new software, skills training, and coordinates training schedules Collaborates with departments in the company to improve systems and processes Maintains relationship with external Information Technology departments and other vendors Provides after-hours support as needed Organizes, attends, and participates in stakeholder meetings Documents and follows up on actions and decisions from meetings Prepares necessary presentation materials as required Ensures project deadlines are maintained Provides administrative support as needed Undertakes project tasks as required Chairs and facilitates meetings where appropriate Distributes project-related materials as requested Acts as a project resource person by performing research, analyzing information, providing documentation, and preparing reports. Successfully manages the relationship with business contacts and all stakeholders Performs other related duties as requested Show more Show less

Title: It Support Engineer I, It Services
Description: Description Are you passionate about helping people solve IT problems? Love being a part of an exciting and innovative environment? Join Amazon IT Services! We’re looking for people who strive to “Work Hard. Have Fun. Make History.” Amazon is seeking bright, adaptable, and hardworking applicants to join our IT Services organization as an IT Support Engineer. IT Support Engineers work with Amazonian's to provide and support the IT equipment and services that are used every day. We treat Amazon employees as our customers and provide timely, accurate, and professional assistance. Amazon's IT Services Support is the first point of contact for technical service requests for Amazon Corporate and its subsidiary employees worldwide. The successful IT Support Engineer will be customer focused and motivated by team success. You will be innovative, energetic, and able to adapt to new processes and procedures quickly while dealing with a high volume of requests. You will also be committed, flexible, and have demonstrated ability to maintain high levels of productivity while maintaining quality support. Key job responsibilities Provide comprehensive technical support to Amazon Corporate employees. Occasional Travel To Other US Cities As Required. Look for innovative process improvements and participate on teams to implement change. Acquire and maintain current knowledge of relevant IT policies in order to provide technically accurate solutions to users. Troubleshoot/support escalations for customer via tickets, beyond the scope of front-line support. Create and maintain documentation. Ticket queue management and ticket auditing across North America. Handle to completion requests and technical project work. Assist with activities to triage and escalate any system or network outage to reduce downtime. Handle escalations from Level 1 support. Follow, update and create standard operating procedures (SOP) to improve the teams' knowledge management. Basic Qualifications High school or equivalent diploma 3+ years of corporate setting Windows, Mac or Linux Operating systems support experience 2+ years of troubleshooting in a multi-user high availability environment experience 1+ years of Windows Server technologies: AD, DFS, Print Services, SCCM experience Preferred Qualifications 2+ years of networking (such as DNS, DHCP, SSL, OSI Model, and TCP/IP) experience 2+ years of supporting and maintaining a corporate network environment experience 4+ years of corporate setting Windows, Mac or Linux Operating systems support experience Experience supporting video conference and teleconference equipment Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status. Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $46,900/year in our lowest geographic market up to $103,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site. Company - Amazon.com Services LLC Job ID: A2978832 Show more Show less

Title: Junior It Support Administrator
Description: We are looking for an individual to join our growing IT team. This individual will be responsible for three key areas of Information Technology. This includes employee on and off boarding, desktop support including license administration for tools and license reclamation/management, and Microsoft 356 Administration which includes adding removing users, resetting passwords, and registering and managing devices or pushing out software updates. Knowledge of basic IT security is desired but not required for this role. Familiarity with phishing training and reporting tools is desired, but not required. Training will be provided as well as leveraging self-service training materials online. The right candidate is an individual who is organized, understands how to write and follow a process document, and cares about timey response to support tickets and customer outcomes. This role has growth potential for any candidate who is engaged and committed to positive outcomes for our employees. This role will work remotely with occasional visits to our Addison, TX office. Additionally, this role will provide on-site support during large company conferences which are held annually. ARM provides a generous 401K package as well as very competitive benefits. You will work along side peers whom will provide on the job training as well as act as a second layer of support for more complex issues and long term projects. General Responsibilities Develop and implement IT procedures by creating documentation detailing the steps of key actions. Write and publish IT Self Support documents to help users mange basic tasks without hands on support – Printer installation, managing email settings, etc… Oversee the resolution of IT incidents (support tickets) and service requests, work to establish SLA’s and improve them over time. Ensure a high level of customer satisfaction through prompt and effective support. Build and maintain inter-departmental relationships and provide positive interactions for all employees Collaborate with other technology teams to assist with integrating new services and solutions into enterprise infrastructure. Manage software and hardware inventory levels to ensure prompt IT Service. Ensure Onboarding and Offboarding activities are coordinated and successful. Develop and implement strategies for continuous improvement including providing suggestions for new solutions, workflows, and tooling to deliver on outcomes. Identify opportunities for automation and operational efficiency. Desired Experience Minimum 3 years of direct experience with Microsoft IT technologies (Specifically Microsoft 365 Admin as and tools like Autopilot and Intune). Demonstrated excellence in customer engagement and experience. Experience managing communications platforms such as Logitech Conference is a plus, equivalent experience with other conference tools and how they’re configured in Microsoft 365 Control Center. Basic knowledge and experience with Ticketing systems such as Jira Service Desk or similar is required. Effective and clear written and oral communication, attention to detail, as well as the ability to adapt to evolving requirements when needed. Have a proven aptitude to successfully work as part of a team. Excellent at troubleshooting and resolving issues with no or minimal assistance. Light work that includes moving objects up to 35 pounds, such as laptops and other typical office equipment. Show more Show less

Title: It Administrator
Description: TITLE: IT Administrator DEPARTMENT: Engineering REPORTS TO: Director, Engineering About the Role: The IT Administrator will support our remote employees and various facilities with all IT needs, including equipment ordering and troubleshooting. How You’ll Make a Difference: Manage the fleet of laptops and tablets, including purchasing, setting up new employees, and troubleshooting; repairs are generally outsourced. Implement a UEM (Unified Endpoint Management) solution to enhance security and compliance Oversee various software accounts, including Slack, Zoom, and Google Workspace. Primarily responsible for onboarding and offboarding accounts, with periodic configuration tasks Assist employees with technical issues, serving as the first point of contact for computer-related difficulties or challenges with third-party software accounts Support on-premise technical tasks, such as setting up printers, troubleshooting wireless connectivity, or installing security cameras Propose and implement new technical solutions, such as a phone tree to meet diverse stakeholder needs Oversee any outsourced IT work, acting as the primary contact for third-party IT vendors as needed Improve documentation and processes to empower employees to solve common technical issues independently Be onsite weekly at either the Vacaville, CA, or Burlington, NJ, facility Be available for limited travel, approximately 1-2 times per year Perform other duties as assigned to support the department’s efficiency and contribute to making Thistle a great workplace! Show more Show less

Title: Service Desk Administrator
Description: Denver, CO- Onsite Monday- Friday, 8:00 am - 5 pm MT Who we are: Hi, we’re SambaSafety and we offer the industry’s most comprehensive driver monitoring software. Our mission is promoting safer communities by reducing risk through data insights. Companies trust SambaSafety to keep their employees safe on the roads, price and reduce risk, help protect their brand, their bottom line, and our global community. We’ve built an inclusive, supportive, and exceptional culture where every employee is empowered in their role. Don’t take our word for it; we’ve been recognized as a Top Workplace by The Denver Post, Albuquerque Journal, Sacramento Bee, and Built In Colorado. And our employees rate SambaSafety as top-notch, with a rock solid Top Rating on Glassdoor. What You’ll Do: As a Service Desk Administrator, you will be a self-starter who consistently demonstrates initiative and drive, provides exceptional support, reviews/manages/resolves customer issues onsite and for remote workers across the US and internationally, relentlessly supports our Denver, Colorado site by working onsite daily with focus on internal collaboration, A/V Teams/Zoom confence rooms used for Executive meetings, Company All Hands meetings, networking, and printers. You will update IT processes with common corrections to issues, deploy/manages/automate end-user Windows and MAC systems, define and implement IT changes, simplify the environment to increase reliability and reduce support burden, work with and elevate the broader team. You will thrive in a fast-paced environment, able to prioritize critical tasks and projects, balancing Denver site support with global IT support for internal customers. Support local Denver, Colorado site hardware and systems, audio and visual conferencing for Teams/Zoom meetings, software, and inventory activities in our corporate offices and in support of our remote workers Accountability for ensuring that IT customer issues are attended to within agreed SLAs, following defined standards for response, with open-to-close ownership, updates, escalation, closure, and creating/updating knowledge base articles Build, manage, and support end-user workstations, Windows and MAC, along with AWS workspaces Troubleshoot, resolve, and update productivity software, security platforms, collaboration tools, and network connectivity related to end-user workstations Deploy and refresh end-user workstations and peripherals to new hires and IT customers both local and remote Leverage and optimize mobile device provisioning software for automation, security, patching, and updates Create and manage end-user accounts, groups, security and distribution groups, corporate access, and application provisioning for customers What you'll need: Curiosity and possess a tenacity for learning Experience maintaining and updating onsite hardware and software systems, including Teams/Zoom rooms for conferenceing, site networking, and printers 1-3 years of providing IT support in an enterprise environment with exceptional customer support Experience in the setup, production, and management of local + remote Company All Hands meetings Associate Degree in Computer Science or other related field/technical school or equivalent work experience Experience managing Office 365, Active Directory and Azure Active Directory, Okta, Windows 11, macOS, and AWS workspaces Thorough understanding of hardware, software, wired/wireless/internet networking, remote access and VPN, endpoint security, and peripherals in both Windows and MAC environments Microsoft/Networking/Security/AWS Certifications desired with mobile device management platform experience preferred (Kandji/NinjaRMM/Intune) Benefits and Perks: Flexible and generous Paid Time Off and Paid Volunteer Days 401k Employer Match Generous Healthcare Benefits Up to 12 weeks paid time off for maternity leave based on tenure Wellness &Tuition Reimbursement Flexible Work Arrangements Lots of SambaSafety swag & SambaSafety Events Our team of talented and committed safety professionals is exceptional. At SambaSafety we strive to foster an inclusive culture that supports, encourages and celebrates a wide array of diversity. We are committed to create a space where all employees can show up as their authentic selves every day, and we work to advance employee equality, diversity and inclusion. SambaSafety provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, gender identity, and expression or genetics. Come join us to find out for yourself what all the excitement is about! Show more Show less

Title: It Infrastructure Support Specialist
Description: Job Summary: We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Infrastructure Support Specialist to support and maintain critical IT infrastructure components with a focus on desktop/laptop support, Wi-Fi and LAN connectivity, firewall administration, and Microsoft 365 services. Key Responsibilities: Provide day-to-day support for desktops, laptops, mobile devices, and peripherals, ensuring optimal performance and minimal downtime for end users. Troubleshoot and resolve network issues related to Wi-Fi, LAN, and VPN connectivity across multiple facilities. Support and maintain firewalls and network security tools, working closely with the security team to enforce access controls and protect sensitive data. Configure, deploy, and support Microsoft 365 services including Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, and Intune. Set up and maintain user workstations, manage Active Directory accounts, and support login/access issues in line with IT security and compliance requirements. Provide technical assistance with software installations, updates, and configurations. Participate in the implementation and support of infrastructure upgrades and system rollouts (e.g., device refreshes, office relocations). Document troubleshooting steps, configurations, and issue resolutions in an ITSM platform, ensuring traceability for audits and compliance. Assist with enforcing IT policies and maintaining compliant environments, especially around data access and device usage in regulated areas. Qualifications: (Understanding that not all may be met) 3+ years of experience in infrastructure or desktop support. Hands-on experience supporting desktops, laptops, and Microsoft 365 environments, including Exchange Online, Teams, and Intune. Strong troubleshooting skills in Wi-Fi, LAN, and basic network infrastructure, including switches and access points. Familiarity with firewall configuration and management (e.g., Palo Alto, Cisco, SonicWall). Working knowledge of Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, and VPN technologies. Excellent customer service and communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users. Certifications such as CompTIA A+, Network+, Microsoft 365 Certified Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with mobile device management (MDM) tools. Exposure to ITSM tools like ServiceNow, Jira, or similar. Knowledge of basic scripting (PowerShell) for automation of routine tasks. Work Environment: Standard office hours with occasional after-hours support for infrastructure maintenance or urgent issues. On-site role with regular presence required at all locations. Show more Show less

Title: It Generalist
Description: Category Information Technology Department Information Technology Description SUMMARY Supports all computers and associated equipment. Supports development and production activities of information systems. Is the desktop systems expert contributing to the day-to-day management of the desktop computing environment. Responsible for the desktop management practice including (but not limited to): maximizing uptime for business and clinical users & applications; developing enterprise-wide standards; and keeping current with IT technology; maintaining end-user computing hardware and coordinating warranty service with vendors. Contributes to and maintains departmental processes and procedures, develops and distributes documentation and training materials, and collaborates with IT peers to improve processes. Creates security access for end-users. Troubleshooting, diagnosing, and correcting problems over the phone, remotely, or in person. Responsible for Equipment Management and deployment. Develops and maintains electronic reporting tools. Assists in creation of end user reports and conducting data base searches. Provides support for interfaces and interface engine. Train under network administrator to provide back up support for telephone and VOIP systems, including communication infrastructure and server based systems. Education Requirements Associates or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems or related field required. Combination of education and experience will be considered. Previous IT and/or computer hardware and software experience a plus. Closing Open until filled Show more Show less

Title: It Support Specialist
Description: Company Description Moneta is an independent Registered Investment Advisor (RIA) wholly focused on going further for our clients. We are one firm with many solutions and we provide a full spectrum of financial advisory services. Still, our true purpose is centered on building relationships and providing exceptional service to our clients around the globe. For that reason, we’ve built an entrepreneurial business model organized around our clients. Our Partner-led teams are empowered to serve only in the best interest of their clients. Plus, our independence means that we are never beholden to stakeholders or parent companies. We also have the unique ability to trace our history back nearly 150 years, which demonstrates our ability to evolve to meet the needs of those we serve. Job Description The IT Support Specialist provides tier-1 technical support for all end users, resolving a wide variety of technical problems on a timely basis, using their solid understanding of core IT concepts to build upon. Essential Responsibilities Responds to Help Desk requests by providing timely and effective technical support to end users. Troubleshoots, identifies and resolves technical issues related to local area networks (LAN) and PC workstations. Sets up, configures, and maintains computer hardware, including desktops, laptops, docking stations, monitors, printers, and scanners. Applies sound judgment to resolve issues efficiently, ensuring high customer satisfaction, minimal downtime, and cost-effective solutions. Follows established procedures and guidelines, while drawing on experience to perform job responsibilities effectively. Contributes to the IT knowledge base by creating and maintaining clear, accurate documentation of technical procedures and resolutions. Other miscellaneous duties, as required. Some travel may be required. Qualifications B.S. Computer Science or related field Three or more years of experience in a related position Technical proficiency with Microsoft, Apple and Android operating systems, tablets, monitors, printers, laptops, modems, routers, VPNs., LANs Must be authorized to work in the United States Additional Information This is a full-time, non-exempt position reporting to the Director of IT. Moneta is committed to providing the best possible care for our employees; part of this care includes offering comprehensive benefits that enhance the well-being of employees and their families: Paid holidays Paid time off (PTO) Employer cost-shared medical and dental insurance Employer-paid short-term disability, long-term disability, AD&D insurance, and basic life insurance 401k Match – 50% of employee contributions up to 6% of compensation Discretionary annual profit-sharing bonus Paid parental leave Professional development reimbursement Paid volunteer time off (VTO) Employee referral incentive bonus program Onsite wellness programs & rewards Employee engagement activities Moneta is a fiduciary fee-only Registered Investment Advisory firm and unable to hold securities licenses with the exception of Series 65. We also do not allow outside business activities, insurance commissions, and/or trails. Show more Show less

Title: It Systems Administrator
Description: Job Description Managed Services Provider seeks a Highly Skilled/Proficient IT Systems Administrator to join our customer support team! Are you ready to take your IT career to the next level? Join our dynamic team as a System Administrator and become a trusted advisor to our clients. This is not your typical Systems Administrator role. You'll spend most of your time visiting customers on-site, managing their environments, and building strong business relationships. You'll work with various technologies and end users, providing top-tier IT support to our extensive client base in and around the Denver Metro area. Adaptability is crucial due to the diverse office cultures and technologies you will encounter. If you have a passion for technology, excellent communication skills, and a business mindset, we want to hear from you! This is NOT a remote position and requires an office and onsite client presence Minimum of 5 years relative IT industry experience Industry Certification or degree is a must to be considered. Responsibilities will include: Manage and support a set number of on-site clients with a regular schedule. Provide desktop support over the phone and in-person, troubleshooting a variety of network and end-user systems. Develop and document technical procedures and end-user guides. Seek ways to apply technology to business processes. Research and provide information on technical trends. Collaborate with our team of technology professionals to deliver best-in-class IT support to over 1600 endpoints. Execute sensitive data backup and restoration procedures. Skills/Qualifications: A desire and aptitude to learn and grow as an IT professional, always challenging yourself and helping others. Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to effectively troubleshoot and diagnose issues, following them to resolution. Strong critical thinking and analytical skills. Detail-oriented, a fast learner, and able to think on the fly. Ability to handle confidential information with utmost respect for the client. Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team setting. Extensive knowledge of Windows desktop, server, and networking systems and protocols. Solid understanding of firewall concepts and cloud-based technologies. Solid understanding of virtual system management using VMWare or Hyper-V. Minimum Requirements: Minimum of 5 years of relevant IT industry experience. Technical certification or IT degree is required. Must be legally eligible to work in the United States. Must be 21 years of age and possess a valid driver’s license. Must have reliable transportation. Must have proof of active automobile liability insurance that meets Colorado State Law requirements. Why Join us? Flexibility: Enjoy a flexible work schedule that allows you to balance work and life. Growth Opportunities: We believe in continuous learning and provide opportunities for professional growth and development. Supportive Environment: Work in a supportive environment where your contributions are valued, and you are not micromanaged. Comprehensive Benefits: We offer a full range of benefits including Medical/Dental/Vision, Retirement, and many others. Community Impact: Be part of a company that believes in giving back to the community and helping others succeed. Our Team Culture: Collaborative: We foster a collaborative environment where team members support each other and work together to solve problems. Innovative: We encourage innovation and creativity, always looking for new ways to improve our services and processes. Inclusive: We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome and respected. Fun: We believe in having fun while working hard. Our team enjoys social events, team-building activities, and celebrating successes together. Customer-Focused: We are dedicated to providing exceptional service to our clients and building long-lasting relationships based on trust and reliability. About initial.IT: Founded in Denver in 2001, Initial.IT has been providing top-level IT support to many firms in the Denver metro area. Our client focus is in the Architectural and Engineering vertical. We offer a flexible work schedule, the opportunity to not be micromanaged, and the belief that everyone deserves an opportunity to succeed, grow, and give back. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and offer a full range of benefits including Medical/Dental/Vision, Retirement, and many others. Show more Show less

Adaptability is crucial due to the diverse office cultures and technologies you will encounter. If you have a passion for technology, excellent communication skills, and a business mindset, we want to hear from you! This is NOT a remote position and requires an office and onsite client presence Minimum of 5 years relative IT industry experience Industry Certification or degree is a must to be considered. Responsibilities will include: Manage and support a set number of on-site clients with a regular schedule. Provide desktop support over the phone and in-person, troubleshooting a variety of network and end-user systems. Develop and document technical procedures and end-user guides. Seek ways to apply technology to business processes. Research and provide information on technical trends. Collaborate with our team of technology professionals to deliver best-in-class IT support to over 1600 endpoints. Execute sensitive data backup and restoration procedures. Skills/Qualifications: A desire and aptitude to learn and grow as an IT professional, always challenging yourself and helping others. Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to effectively troubleshoot and diagnose issues, following them to resolution. Strong critical thinking and analytical skills. Detail-oriented, a fast learner, and able to think on the fly. Ability to handle confidential information with utmost respect for the client. Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team setting. Extensive knowledge of Windows desktop, server, and networking systems and protocols. Solid understanding of firewall concepts and cloud-based technologies. Solid understanding of virtual system management using VMWare or Hyper-V. Minimum Requirements: Minimum of 5 years of relevant IT industry experience. Technical certification or IT degree is required. Must be legally eligible to work in the United States. Must be 21 years of age and possess a valid driver’s license. Must have reliable transportation. Must have proof of active automobile liability insurance that meets Colorado State Law requirements. Why Join us? Flexibility: Enjoy a flexible work schedule that allows you to balance work and life. Growth Opportunities: We believe in continuous learning and provide opportunities for professional growth and development. Supportive Environment: Work in a supportive environment where your contributions are valued, and you are not micromanaged. Comprehensive Benefits: We offer a full range of benefits including Medical/Dental/Vision, Retirement, and many others. Community Impact: Be part of a company that believes in giving back to the community and helping others succeed. Our Team Culture: Collaborative: We foster a collaborative environment where team members support each other and work together to solve problems. Innovative: We encourage innovation and creativity, always looking for new ways to improve our services and processes. Inclusive: We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome and respected. Fun: We believe in having fun while working hard. Our team enjoys social events, team-building activities, and celebrating successes together. Customer-Focused: We are dedicated to providing exceptional service to our clients and building long-lasting relationships based on trust and reliability. About initial.IT: Founded in Denver in 2001, Initial.IT has been providing top-level IT support to many firms in the Denver metro area. Our client focus is in the Architectural and Engineering vertical. We offer a flexible work schedule, the opportunity to not be micromanaged, and the belief that everyone deserves an opportunity to succeed, grow, and give back. Title: System Administrator - Microsoft 365 And On-Prem
Description: Tom James is the world’s largest manufacturer and retailer of made-to-order clothing and the engine behind one of the most established tailored clothing brands. As one of the few remaining vertically integrated clothing retailers-controlling the entire manufacturing process ‘from sheep to suit’ – we offer unparalleled value to those with an eye for quality. We are excited to announce a new opportunity for a System Administrator to join our team. The Microsoft 365 and On-Prem System Administrator will help oversee the day-to-day operations of the Tom James IT infrastructure - ensuring systems are secure, efficient, and available to support business operations. This includes administering Microsoft 365 tenants, managing and configuring servers, networks, and related hardware/software, troubleshooting issues, and implementing solutions to maintain system performance and security. Key Responsibilities Microsoft 365 Administration: Help manage, configure, and license Microsoft cloud-based productivity services including Exchange, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive. System Management: Install, configure, and maintain servers (physical and virtual), operating systems (e.g., Windows, Linux, Unix), and software applications. Network Administration: Monitor and manage network infrastructure, including routers, switches, and firewalls, to ensure connectivity and performance. Security: Implement and maintain security measures, including firewalls, antivirus software, and patch management, to protect systems from threats. Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve hardware, software, and network issues in a timely manner to minimize downtime. Work with Help Desk on escalated tickets. Backup and Recovery: Develop and maintain backup strategies to ensure data integrity and perform disaster recovery operations when needed. User Management: Manage user accounts, permissions, and access controls to ensure secure and efficient access to systems and resources. Performance Monitoring: Monitor system performance, analyze logs, and optimize configurations to ensure reliability and scalability. Documentation: Maintain detailed documentation of system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps. Automation: Develop scripts (e.g., PowerShell, Bash) to automate routine tasks and improve system efficiency. Collaboration: Work with IT teams, vendors, and stakeholders to implement new technologies, upgrades, or system migrations. Compliance: Ensure systems comply with organizational policies, industry standards, and regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA). The ideal candidate would have experience in the following: Microsoft 365 (required) Microsoft Active Directory (on prem) and Entra Meraki and SonicWall firewalls, switches, and WAP’s Nutanix AHV Hyperconverged appliances Sentinel One and Reliaquest Greymatter security platforms Unitrends, Barracuda, and HYCU backups Citrix and Remote Desktop Services Dell Servers IBM i Servers Qualifications Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience). Experience: 3-5 years of experience in system administration, network management, or a related IT role. Microsoft 365 experience required. Skills Proficiency with operating systems (e.g., Windows Server and Desktop, Linux, IBM i). Knowledge of virtualization platforms (e.g., Nutanix AHV, Hyper-V,). Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Experience with network protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP). Scripting skills (e.g., PowerShell, Bash). Understanding of cybersecurity best practices and tools. Strong problem-solving, communication, and time-management skills; ability to work independently and in a team. Work Environment On-site presence required with some Remote work possible when needed May require on-call availability for after-hours support or emergencies. Ability to lift and manage hardware (e.g., servers, networking equipment). Light travel may be required. Why this is a great opportunity Tom James is an industry leader, and we have grown steadily every year we’ve been in business. Our worldwide team is made up of smart, dedicated, interesting people who make terrific coworkers. We offer a competitive starting salary, an outstanding benefits package including PTO, medical, dental, and vision insurance, short- & long-term disability, and of course 401(k) with match and stock. Title: Systems Administrator
Description: MacKay Sposito is seeking an established Systems Administrator with a strong emphasis on networking to join our IT team. This new mid-level role provides advanced technical support and is responsible for maintaining and optimizing our network infrastructure, while also contributing to broader IT operations including virtualization, and cloud-based technologies. The ideal candidate brings a blend of hands-on experience with switches, firewalls, VLANs, routing, hypervisors, networking, and remote access tools management. MacKay Sposito is a growing firm currently supporting several branch offices in Washington and California. Occasional travel may be required to provide onsite support across these locations. This position is perfect for someone who enjoys solving complex networking problems, optimizing system performance, and working across multiple IT domains in a collaborative environment. You'll be part of a cross-trained IT team where you can grow your skills, make a real impact, and gain exposure to cloud, virtualization, and enterprise IT systems. Key Responsibilities: Networking & Infrastructure Support Configure, monitor, and troubleshoot network infrastructure including VLANs, switches, firewalls, access points, and routers Maintain and optimize DHCP, DNS, and VPN services Assist with network segmentation, subnetting, routing policies, and wireless coverage planning Support and secure remote access technologies including VPN Monitor network performance, conduct root cause analysis, and resolve connectivity issues Manage virtual networking within VMware hypervisor environments, including virtual switches, port groups, and network uplinks IT Systems & Operations Provide Tier 2/3 support for escalated IT issues involving hardware, software, and connectivity Support Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops environments Administer Microsoft 365, Azure AD, and endpoint management tools Perform system updates, patching, and endpoint hardening Assist with user account management, group policy adjustments, and file access control Participate in system documentation and infrastructure diagrams Collaboration & Escalation Collaborate with IT team members on infrastructure projects and implementations Interface with vendors and third-party support for advanced troubleshooting or escalations Provide knowledge-sharing and mentorship for other support staff as needed Qualifications & Experience: 5+ years of experience in IT infrastructure and support roles with a strong networking background Proficiency in networking protocols and configuration: VLANs, TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPNs, routing, and switching Hands-on experience with network hardware from Cisco, Ubiquiti, Fortinet, or similar vendors Experience managing VMware/Nutanix/Citrix hypervisor network configurations Familiarity with Citrix technologies Experience managing Microsoft 365, Active Directory, and Azure AD Strong problem-solving skills and ability to manage multiple tasks effectively Preferred Qualifications Certifications such as CompTIA Network+, Cisco CCNA, Fortinet NSE or related Experience with network monitoring and diagnostic tools (e.g., Wireshark, PRTG, SolarWinds, etc) Familiarity with endpoint protection platforms and centralized management tools Experience with Physical, Virtual networking within VMWare and or Citrix is a plus Scripting experience (PowerShell, Bash, or Python) is a plus Why join the MacKay Sposito team? A people-first culture - We are dedicated to our employees and their families. We want to do what’s best for them, and their well-being helps drive our business decisions. Excellent reputation - Through our 50-year history, MacKay Sposito has built and maintained an excellent reputation in our community, and with our clients and business partners. You’ll be joining a team with a strong foundation and reputation that you can be proud to be part of We give back to the community - MacKay Sposito and our employees believe in giving back to the communities we serve. As a firm, we supported a host of local organizations focusing on our community pillars of veterans and youth. Our team members volunteer as commissioners, committee and board members, youth coaches, and a host of other volunteer positions and initiatives Our Values: At MacKay Sposito, we’re serious about our work, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. We have a unique and diverse mix of employees who enjoy each other’s company. In addition to having first-rate technical skills, we search out people who are friendly, honest and dedicated to their work. We know work isn't only about who you work for, it is also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate to make great things possible. We believe firmly in the principle of constructive candor – always telling the client everything they need to know to make fully informed decisions. By creating a positive, committed and supportive environment, we’re able to challenge our people to be the best that they can be, and to celebrate every success. Who We Are: With more than 50 years of experience, MacKay Sposito is a multidisciplinary firm based in Vancouver, Washington, specializing in public works, energy, and land development. Our passionate team focuses on building lasting relationships through quality work, creative design, and collaboration. We offer civil engineering, land surveying, environmental science and permitting, landscape architecture, and construction management and inspection services. With the addition of our subsidiary, Riparia Environmental, we now deliver a full suite of services from design and engineering to maintenance and environmental compliance. Together, we balance development with environmental stewardship and sustainability. We encourage you to ask around about us. Do some digging. We’re confident that you’ll want to learn more. And we look forward to talking with you about a future with MacKay Sposito. Salaries are based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as various market and business considerations. The wage range for this position is $85,000 - $98,000, annually, depending on experience. Full-time employees receive a well-rounded benefits package, including access to our company-sponsored Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, HSA and Supplemental Life Insurance plans. 100% company paid Life Insurance, Short Term Disability, and Long Term Disability coverage. Employees are eligible to participate in our company 401k plan with up to a 4% match. Additionally, employees also receive paid vacation time, paid sick time, and 11 paid holidays. MacKay Sposito pays for expenses associated with licensure as well as annual profit-sharing bonuses. Employment requires passing a pre-employment background check and drug screen. We participate in E-Verify and are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Powered by JazzHR Sjlaz12VOB Show more Show less

Title: Systems Administrator

Our corporate culture, engineering talent, customer-centric approach, and focus upon NextGen services help us stand out among our peers. Thrive is on the look-out for individuals who don’t view their weekdays spent at ‘a job’ but rather look to develop valuable skills that ignite their passion and lead to a CAREER. If you’re attracted to a work hard, play hard environment and seek the guidance, training and experience necessary to build a lucrative career, then welcome to THRIVE! Position Summary We are currently seeking a Systems Administrator to work within the engineering team to serve our growing client base in the Birmingham area. Systems Administrators have responsibility for both onsite and remote client support, including heavy interaction with end-users in diverse computing environments. Engineers are challenged daily working in an energetic, fast moving, collaborative, demanding & results-oriented work environment. Thrive is looking to hire individuals who demonstrate technical proficiency, have strong verbal and written communication skills and have the desire to learn and be involved in all aspects of IT. Thrive provides a unique work environment for ambitious individuals through an unparalleled diversity of work and opportunities for growth. Responsibilities Analyze and document an unfamiliar client / server network environment while assessing the quickest path to resolution for a particular incident affecting the network. Perform rapid analysis of workstation /server level incidents and consistently demonstrate the ability to determine the root cause. Ability to handle diverse computing environments in a wide cross section of business environments. Develop client standards based on Thrive best practices and document as well as evaluate needs across client base. Troubleshoot and research server level issues and network level issues independently. Vast technical understanding and ability to understand escalation notes and quickly determine and resolve complicated technical issues. Identify reoccurring issues that are being dealt with in the remote service center and develop a plan to resolve permanently through problem management. Constant review of security best practices in relation to client environments to uncover, suggest internally and proactively resolve any potential risks as part of change management. Work directly with Team Lead to implement designated standards across customer base to improve service delivery. Resolution of incidents related to, but not limited to the following: Mail Application/Office 365 issues Firewall Issues including but not limited to SSLVPN, Site to Site VPN, Access Rules Troubleshooting & Assessment of backup/disaster recovery solutions to ensure data retention and uptime Client/Server Connectivity issues (per SOP) Data restores both at the individual file level and company wide Remote Access incidents (Citrix and Terminal Services) Any Incidents escalated from Systems Engineers Requirements Bachelor’s Degree, Technical Degree or equivalent work experience Excellent problem solver; able to prioritize and coordinate between tasks 6+ years desktop and/or server support experience Self-motivated, has ability to work independently and in a team environment Experience designing network architectures inclusive of LAN/WAN networking and Windows Servers Experience troubleshooting network configuration and hardware issues Experience troubleshooting server hardware issues Knowledge and experience with Microsoft Server and Workstation Technologies Excellent written and oral communication skills Ability to articulate technical information and convey to non-technical people Excellent customer service skills Ability to follow previously documented process while notifying management of variables that have not been clarified Is available to work after hours when necessary or for on call rotation if applicable Must be able to work effectively in a team environment as well as alone Preferred Requirements CompTIA Net + MCSE / MCITP: Server Administrator or above VCA/VCP Show more Show less

Title: Windows System Administrator
Description: We’re seeking a skilled and strategic Systems Administrator to ensure the stability, security, and performance of core IT systems, with a focus on Microsoft Entra, Intune, and server infrastructure. This role is ideal for someone with deep technical knowledge, hands-on experience, and strong leadership skills. Key Responsibilities: • Configure, maintain, and monitor physical and virtual servers. • Manage identity and access systems using Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) and Active Directory. • Oversee device and application management through Microsoft Intune, including MDM and endpoint compliance. • Install, configure, and troubleshoot server hardware and networking equipment. • Support on-prem infrastructure including switches, storage systems, and printers. • Perform proactive maintenance and implement hardware upgrades. • Enforce IT security policies related to access control and data protection. • Monitor systems for vulnerabilities and assist with remediation and audits. • Lead IT projects such as system upgrades, migrations, and deployments. • Collaborate with cross-functional teams and vendors to implement solutions. • Mentor junior team members and share best practices. • Manage and resolve support tickets, with a focus on user satisfaction. • Provide expert-level troubleshooting for end users. • Maintain documentation and build a knowledge base for recurring issues. Qualifications: • Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, or related field preferred. • progressive experience in systems administration or IT support. • Knowledge of NTFS permissions, DFS, DHCP, DNS, GPO, and Hyper-V. • Hands-on experience with Microsoft Entra (Azure AD) and Intune a plus • Proficient in Windows Server environments and advanced hardware troubleshooting. • PowerShell or scripting experience preferred. • Relevant certifications (Azure Administrator Associate, Windows Server) a plus. Additional Skills: • Solid understanding of Microsoft 365 and Windows OS. • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills. • Proven ability to work independently and lead support efforts. Title: Jr. Systems Administrator
Description: Description JOB SUMMARY (added Nov 2023) The Jr. Systems Administrator is responsible for assisting in the day-to-day management, maintenance, and support of computer systems. The Jr. Systems Administrator works under the guidance of senior systems administrators to ensure the smooth operation of hardware, software, and network components. Essential Duties & Responsibilities User Support: Provide technical assistance and support to end-users for hardware, software, and network-related issues. Respond to user inquiries and resolve problems in a timely manner. Assist with user account management, password resets, and access permissions. System Monitoring and Maintenance: Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure optimal operation. Perform routine maintenance tasks such as system updates, patches, and backups. Proactively identify potential issues and take corrective actions to prevent downtime. System Deployment and Upgrades: Assist in the deployment of new systems, including hardware installation and software configuration. Support system upgrades and migrations, ensuring minimal disruption to TDS associates. Collaborate with senior administrators to plan and execute system projects. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate documentation of system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps. Generate reports on system performance, incident resolution, and user support metrics. Contribute to the development and improvement of IT policies, procedures, and guidelines. Qualifications KNOWLEDGE & REQUIREMENTS Knowledge of computer systems, networks, and operating systems (Windows, Linux, etc.). Familiarity with network protocols and technologies (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPN, etc.). Proficiency in troubleshooting hardware, software, and network issues. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and in a team environment. Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking abilities. Attention to detail and ability to prioritize tasks effectively Education & Experience Requirements Minimum years of work experience: 2 years in Information Technology sector experience or equivalent Minimum level of education or education/experience: Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in a computer-related field (e.g., Computer Science, Information Technology). Physical Requirements The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Frequent sitting in stationary position at a desk Occasional standing, walking, stooping, kneeling, squatting, and climbing stairs Occasional twisting of body Occasional reaching by extending hands and arms in any direction Occasional lifting, pulling, or pushing What’s In It For You? Medical, Dental and Vision Plans Voluntary Benefits HSA & FSA Fertility & Family Planning Benefits Paid Parental Leave Adoption Assistance Program Employee Resource Groups Flex PTO for Exempt Associates & up to 15 PTO days in first year of employment for non-exempt associates 11 Paid Holidays Corporate Wellness Program 401k Employer Match & Roth Option Available – immediate eligibility Show more Show less

Title: It System Administrator
Description: We partner and innovate with our customers to provide the highest quality, life enhancing medical devices in the world. As an IT Administrator – IT Operations, you will take charge and provide decisive technical leadership and unwavering support to your assigned site(s). This dynamic role demands expertise across several IT domains, including System Administration, Networking, Technical Support (Break/Fix), Project Management, and Business Analysis. You will drive IT projects forward, spearhead continuous improvement initiatives, and actively collaborate with the Viant site leadership team to maximize the strategic use of technological resources. You will be instrumental in positioning your site to overcome future IT challenges, leveraging your robust technical expertise to craft and deploy innovative solutions that guarantee reliability and scalability. By aligning IT operations seamlessly with business objectives, your efforts will ensure the uninterrupted manufacturing of medical devices. Additionally, you will engage with every department within Viant, building meaningful connections and expanding your professional horizons through diverse interactions and projects. As a key member of the Viant IT team, you will embody and champion Viant values, operating with integrity, accountability, and an unwavering commitment to excellence. Your leadership and contributions will be pivotal to the success and advancement of Viant. Location: This position is intendend to support 4 days of the week the Ft.Wayne, IN site and 1 day of the week the Indianapolis, IN facility. Key Responsabilities And Duties Act in alignment with the core values of the company, demonstrating agility, teamwork, leadership, ownership, customer focus, and integrity in all actions. Provide support outside regular working hours to ensure ongoing IT Support and address urgent issues. when required to support business operations. Collaborate closely with site operations and business leaders to develop and uphold effective processes and procedures. Engage actively in company-wide and site-specific projects aimed at continuous improvement of processes. Provide administrative support and maintenance for Microsoft 365 applications, including Teams, OneDrive, Exchange, and SharePoint, ensuring optimal functionality and user experience. Oversee and maintain the Entra Admin and Active Directory environment, focusing on tasks such as user and group management, as well as implementing and managing security and group policies. Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups. Responsible for installing, configuring, maintaining, and repairing workstations, laptops, peripherals, and site IT resources, including software, UPS systems, printers, and copiers. Track individual and site IT performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and recommend solutions to optimize efficiency in service support and delivery processes. Tasked with managing IT help desk requests to ensure prompt and effective communication, as well as timely resolutions. Create and maintain documentation of procedures, knowledge bases, policy documents and configurations well-maintained and up to date and alignment with the Viant IT standards. Oversee IT procurement and inventory for hardware, software, peripherals, and related supplies. Enhance endpoint security by monitoring vulnerabilities and applying relevant patches and updates effectively. Identify and recommend system, hardware and software improvements/upgrades. Maintain knowledge of Viant corporate IT policies and Viant privacy policies. Report any security incident or suspected security incident to the Viant Security Incident Response Team. All other duties as assigned. Knowledge/Education Job Requirements: Associates Degree in Computer Science or other technical field is required Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or other technical field is preferred Job Experience 4-6 years of system administrator experience is required 4-6 years of diversified experience in a manufacturing environment is preferred 2-3 years in medical environment is preferred Skills/Competencies Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal are required in both English and Spanish (bilingual requirement only applies for Mexico, Costa Rica and Puerto Rico locations), with the proficiency to collaborate and engage with stakeholders at all levels. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced team environment as well as independently. Resourcefulness in handling unexpected challenges. Must have excellent time management skills with the ability to work independently with little supervision. Highly self-motivated, enthusiastic who has the ability to understand and take the “big picture” into account Strong aptitude for working with technology, ability to learn and absorb new technologies quickly. Proven capability in managing multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritizing time efficiently. Demonstrated understanding of fundamental critical thinking concepts, with a proven ability to apply these principles to effective problem solving. Proven documentation skills including policies and procedures. Pro-active in identifying potential issues with a proposed process or systems change. Hands on experience installing IT hardware, peripherals and software. Skilled with Windows operating systems, Entra/Active Directory, Intune, O365 applications such as OneDrive, SharePoint, Teams etc. Intermediate Knowledge in Backup solutions, MSP360, is a plus. Basic Knowledge of cloud storage services, Wasabi & AWS preferred. Knowledge with VoIP systems, particularly 3CX is a plus. Knowledge in TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPN, VLAN’s, and wireless networks. Knowledge of VMWare virtualized environment. Understanding of compliance and security standards. Understand and provide support to ensure compliance with external audits from customers, vendors, and the FDA. Knowledge in Cisco Meraki and UNIFI switching is a plus. Knowledge in Endpoint Central is a plus. Travel Up to 25% of the time or as needed. Physical Requirements Work in an office environment with varying amounts of walking, sitting, standing, twisting, and turning. Long periods of time working on a computer, using hands and fingers extensively. Able to lift 15 pounds, bending, lifting on occasion. Benefits New employees are eligible for the following benefits effective date of hire! Medical, dental, and vision benefits Company-paid life insurance and disability benefits Generous Paid time off and 10 paid Holidays 401k Plan with Company Match Tuition Reimbursement Voluntary Universal Life and Long-Term Care Voluntary Legal Plan Pet Insurance Home Ownership Program Viant is a global medical device design and manufacturing services provider that partners and innovates with customers to provide the highest quality, life enhancing medical devices. We do this through our depth and breadth of capabilities, end-to-end integration, technical expertise, and relentless focus on our customers and on operational excellence. With nearly 6,000 associates across 24 locations worldwide, we offer a unique combination of small-company service and attention with big-company resources. For more information, visit viantmedical.com or follow us on LinkedIn. Viant provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. Viant complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. Show more Show less

Title: System Administrator (Azure)
Description: System Administrator (Azure) 📍 Pittsburgh, PA | 🕒 Hybrid (2 days on-site per week) About eNGINE: eNGINE builds Technical Teams. We are a Solutions and Placement firm shaped by decades of interaction with Technical professionals. Our inspiration is continuous learning and engagement with the markets we serve, the talent we represent, and the teams we build. Our Consulting Workforce is encouraged to enjoy career fulfillment in the form of challenging projects, schedule flexibility, and paid training/certifications. Successful outcomes start and finish with eNGINE. About the Role: eNGINE is seeking a skilled System Administrator with Azure experience to join our team in Pittsburgh. This hybrid role (2 days/week on-site) is ideal for someone who thrives in a dynamic environment, enjoys collaboration across IT disciplines, and has a passion for optimizing and securing infrastructure systems. As a System Administrator, you'll play a key role in managing both on-premises and cloud-based systems, with a particular focus on Microsoft Azure, Windows Server environments, and endpoint management platforms. You'll collaborate closely with networking, security, and application teams to ensure our infrastructure remains secure, scalable, and high-performing. Key Responsibilities: Administer Windows Server platforms, including Active Directory , Group Policy , and RDS/VDI environments. Manage Azure resources: virtual machines, resource groups, backup policies, and update automation. Monitor system activity and investigate anomalies using Microsoft Sentinel and Log Analytics . Support identity and access management using Azure AD , SSO , and Conditional Access policies. Maintain endpoints with Intune and SCCM : provisioning, patching, and compliance reporting. Oversee system patching, backups, and disaster recovery planning and execution. Provide administrative support for Microsoft 365 services (Exchange Online, SharePoint, Defender). Collaborate with cross-functional teams in security, networking, and applications. Document procedures and system configurations; mentor junior staff as needed. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience). 3+ years of experience in a System Administrator or similar infrastructure support role. Strong experience with Windows Server , Active Directory , and Group Policy management. Hands-on experience with RDS/VDI environments. Experience with Microsoft Sentinel and Intune/SCCM . Basic knowledge of firewall technologies (e.g., FortiGate) to support the security/networking team in a backup capacity. Familiarity with ServiceNow or similar ITSM tools. Preferred Qualifications: Microsoft Azure or M365 certifications. Exposure to Ubiquiti/Unifi network devices. Experience scripting with PowerShell for automation. Background in compliance or IT governance frameworks (e.g., NIST, ISO, HIPAA). Familiarity with cloud cost optimization strategies. No C2C, relocation, or sponsorship for this role. For finer details on how eNGINE can enhance your career, apply today! Show more Show less

Title: It Systems Administrator (On-Site – New York City Only)
Description: Location: On-site – New York City, NY Eligibility: Applicants must currently reside in the New York City area. This is an on-site position, and only local candidates will be considered. We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated IT Systems Administrator to join our team. This on-site role is based in New York City, and only applicants currently residing in the NYC area will be considered. The IT Systems Administrator will be responsible for maintaining and supporting the organization’s IT infrastructure, ensuring systems are running efficiently, securely, and with minimal downtime. The role involves troubleshooting issues, managing network and server configurations, supporting end users, and implementing system improvements. Key Responsibilities: Server Management: Assist with installation, configuration, and maintenance of operating systems, software, and hardware, including servers, storage, and network devices. Network Support: Assist with the maintenance of local area networks (LAN), wireless networks, and cloud systems, ensuring secure and reliable communication. User Support: Provide technical support for internal users, resolving hardware, software, and network issues in a timely manner. Documentation: Create and maintain detailed documentation for network configurations, system setups, and procedures for troubleshooting. Collaboration: Work closely with other teams and departments to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve technical challenges. Project Support: Participate in IT projects, system upgrades, and network expansions as needed. Collaborate closely with Managed Service Providers on technology projects, maintenance, and support. Training & Development: Stay current with emerging technologies and best practices to enhance overall system performance and security. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience). Proven experience as a Systems Administrator, Network Administrator, or similar role preferred Strong knowledge of PC hardware, operating systems (Linux, Windows Server, etc.), and network infrastructure. Proficient in scripting and automation tools (e.g., PowerShell, Bash, Ansible) preferred Solid understanding of security protocols, firewalls, and VPNs preferred Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with various teams and end users. Preferred Skills: Experience with Azure, network engineering, monitoring tools, and performance tuning. IT certifications such as CompTIA Network+, CompTIA Security+, Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA), or Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) are a plus. Knowledge of ITIL or other IT service management frameworks. Physical Requirements: Ability to lift and move equipment (up to 50 pounds). Occasional on-call availability for after-hours support. Location Requirement: Please note: This is a full-time, on-site position located in New York City. Only applicants currently living in the New York City area are eligible for consideration. Relocation assistance is not available for this role. Show more Show less

Title: System Administrator
Description: System Administrator (On-site) Location: Long Beach, CA (5 days on-site) This job expects to pay about $45 - 50 per hour plus benefits We are need of a contract to hire System Administrator to join a leading construction equipment manufacturer. The System Administrator is responsible for maintaining and supporting the company's IT infrastructure, ensuring the smooth operation of computer systems, networks, and related technologies. Additionally, you will be responsible for managing the company's Azure cloud infrastructure, ensuring its optimal performance, security, and scalability. What You Will Do: Install, configure, and maintain physical servers, virtual servers, Azure cloud services, software, hardware, and networks. Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues. Help manage and support Microsoft Intune for device management, application deployment, and security policies. Ensure security through configuration and management of Azure Entra access controls and the Microsoft Defender Administration Console. Respond to system alerts and end-user tickets to quickly diagnose problems and coach end-users through software and hardware-related resolutions. Collaborate with IT team members onsite and remotely to build and maintain positive, productive team relationships. Perform “root cause analysis” when the Service Desk escalates problems/tickets and implement recommended improvements to address systemic level issues. Participate in the IT Teams weekend on-call support rotation and perform necessary after-hours server, network, system maintenance, and other technical updates. Occasional travel to branch offices to provide on-site user and network support, provision new offices, and de-commission closing offices. Inventory new equipment and software and perform periodic audits of deployed assets. Prepare and publish self-help documentation for IT support reference and common “how to” problems into the knowledge base. Assist in training and mentoring junior technicians and new team members. What You Bring to the Table: 1-3+ years as a Systems Administrator and an Associate’s degree and/or Bachelor’s degree. Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Azure/Entra/Defender Strong working knowledge of M365 with administration experience Proficient with InTune – config/setup, deployment, MDM, policies, etc. Advanced technical skills and credentials, including network administration, system administration, and cloud administration (e.g., MCSE, MC Azure Solutions Architect). Strong working knowledge of Active Directory – ability to create/modify/disable accounts. Proven mastery of Windows operating systems, including Windows 10 and 11, Windows Server, and SQL Server. Experience with environments of 800 users or more preferred. Excellent documentation and organizational skills. Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. Experience with the following technologies: MS Office 365, including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Microsoft Teams, Outlook/Exchange Online, and SharePoint Online. Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Services. Meraki network devices, including Switches, Firewalls, and WAPs. Wi-Fi / VPN / Mobile Access. Service Now ticket management and Autotask Datto Kaseya for RMM Proofpoint Email/SPAM filtering. Microsoft Certified Professional and A+ certification preferred. Certified Network Associate credential is a plus. Irvine Technology Corporation (ITC) is a leading provider of technology and staffing solutions for IT, Security, Engineering, and Interactive Design disciplines servicing startups to enterprise clients, nationally. We pride ourselves in the ability to introduce you to our intimate network of business and technology leaders – bringing you opportunity coupled with personal growth, and professional development! Join us. Let us catapult your career! Irvine Technology Corporation provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Irvine Technology Corporation complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.
