Title: Senior It Systems Engineer, Ops
Description: At GFiber, we believe that great internet has the power to drive innovation, strengthen communities, enable the impossible, and do all the everyday things that make all of our world go round. And the job of creating better internet is never done - so we’re growing! Our team is committed to building a place where people who want to make a difference can grow their careers and find their spot to belong. GFiber is an Alphabet company that brings Google Fiber and Google Fiber Webpass internet services to homes and businesses across the United States. Our teams are expanding as we connect more cities and people to exceptional internet. The application window will be open until at least July 18, 2025 . This opportunity will remain online based on business needs which may be before or after the specified date. At GFiber, our Information Systems and Technology plays a crucial role in enhancing employee productivity and efficiency across all departments. We are dedicated to delivering quality support while fostering a strong business partnership and ensuring seamless project deliverables. Together, we focus on delivering innovative solutions that empower our colleagues and drive the organization forward. Role Description As a Senior IT Systems Engineer, in the IT Corp team, your role is pivotal in ensuring smooth operations and comprehensive support for cross-functional teams within GFiber. You'll drive efficiency by automating processes and leveraging your technical support expertise, strategic mindset, and leadership abilities to implement IT solutions across our expanding organization. In this role, you'll: Foster strong relationships with cross-functional teams to deeply understand their business processes and IT needs. Diagnose and troubleshoot network and software issues promptly, ensuring minimal disruption to operations. Resolve complex hardware, software, and networking challenges efficiently to maintain high availability. Proactively identify opportunities for IT solutions that streamline operations and enhance productivity. Collaborate with stakeholders to implement scalable IT systems and infrastructure solutions. At a minimum we'd like you to have: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field; or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience as a Systems Engineer in a Corporate IT environment. Experience implementing and managing Identity and Access Management including Single Sign-On, multi-factor authentication, role-based access control, and identity lifecycle management in Okta. Experience implementing workflow automations through Okta Workflow. Experience implementing system integrations through API’s, webhook, and pre-built connectors. It's preferred if you have: 8 years of experience as a Systems Engineer in a Corporate IT environment. Experience with scripting languages (Python, Javascript, Powershell, etc.) to deploy advanced system integrations. Experience in managing operating systems (e.g., Windows, ChromeOS, MacOS). Experience with device management solutions (e.g., Kandji, Intune, Workspace). Experience managing multiple identity management solutions (e.g., Okta, Entra ID). Experience with data manipulation and transformation between systems including JSON and various data types. The US base salary range for this full-time position is between $136,000 - $198,000 + bonus + cash award + benefits. As pay varies by location, your recruiter will share more about the specific salary range for your targeted location during the hiring process. GFiber is committed to equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or Veteran status. Disclosure is voluntary, and this information will be kept confidential in compliance with Google's Candidate Privacy Policy. For more information please refer to our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy and the EEOC's "Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal" (PDF). It's important to us to create an accessible, inclusive workplace for everyone. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our accommodations for applicants form. Our candidate accommodations team will then connect with you to confidentially discuss your options. Show more Show less

Title: System Engineer
Description: Are you ready to make a difference in the world of consumer finance? At Attain Finance, we bring over 50 years of expertise in providing credit solutions across the U.S. and Canada. Our deep roots in the financial industry have empowered us to develop convenient, easily accessible financial services that meet our customers' growing needs. Join a leading consumer credit lender that thrives on innovation and collaboration, where your contributions are truly valued. Our portfolio includes distinguished brands like Cash Money®, LendDirect®, Heights Finance, Southern Finance, Covington Credit, Quick Credit, and First Heritage Credit. Each brand is constantly evolving to better serve our customers. Be part of a dynamic team that is shaping the future of consumer finance. Apply today and take the next step in your career with Attain Finance! Responsibilities We are seeking a proactive and innovative Senior System Engineer who excels at diagnosing and solving issues. You will excel in this role if you are a self-starter passionate about AWS/Azure and Windows server technologies. A main focus will be on stability and performance while modernizing our legacy enterprise systems. A deep understanding of our business needs and a commitment to enhancing processes for improved system stability and efficiency are essential. What you will be doing: Installing, configuring, and maintaining Windows servers and workstations, w ith a focus on automation Developing and implementing automation scripts and tools to streamline system management tasks M anaging identity and permissions securely in Active Directory, AWS, and Entra ID Monitoring system performance, identifying issues, and implementing solutions to ensure optimal operation with a strong understanding of Client-Server network communication issues Ensuring systems are secure and compliant with company policies and industry standards Creating and maintaining detailed documentation and diagrams of system configurations, procedures, and automation scripts Working closely with other IT teams to integrate systems and support business operations Including DNS management in AWS, Azure, and legacy Active Directory for the purposes of stability, troubleshooting, and providing improvement recommendations Qualifications What you should have: Proficiency in Windows Server, Active Directory, and Entra ID is essential Strong scripting skills in PowerShell are required ; experience with other automation tools is a plus Knowledge of network protocols and services (DNS, DHCP, TCP/IP) Familiarity with Azure and AWS in regard to server deployment and automation, including experience with services such as EC2, S3, RDS, and Azure VMs Excellent problem-solving skills demonstrated through successful resolution of complex system issues in a fast paced environment Strong communication skills, including experience collaborating with cross-functional teams to achieve project goals. Base Salary: $80,000 - $110,000 The base salary range represents the low and high end of the anticipated salary range for this position based on the U.S. average. The actual base salary offered for this full-time position will be determined by various factors, including but not limited to, location, skills, knowledge, competencies, and experience. All full-time salaried employees are eligible for the following benefits, starting on day one: Flexible Paid Time Off Program, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Disability, and other voluntary coverages. You will also be eligible to participate in our 401k program, starting on the first of the month following 30 days of employment with a company match. This employer participates in E-Verify for US-based hires. # AttainFinance EEO Statement Attain Finance Supports Equal Employment Opportunity. CURO (dba Cash Money®, LendDirect®, Heights Finance, Southern Finance, Covington Credit, Quick Credit, and First Heritage Credit) is committed to a policy of providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified employees and applicants. This commitment is reflected in all aspects of our daily operations. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, or genetic information in any personnel practice, including recruitment, hiring, training, compensation, promotion, and discipline. Additionally, we do not discriminate based on any other characteristic protected by applicable state/provincial or local law where a particular employee works. In addition, it is the policy of Attain Finance to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified employees who have protected disabilities to the extent required by federal law and any state/provincial law where a particular employee works. Notice to Attain Finance job applicants: Attain Finance will never ask for your personal banking information, transfer of funds, a credit card, or for you to purchase any equipment to process a job application or for training. Authorized Attain Finance representatives' email addresses will end in @attainfinace.com, @curo.com, @first-heritage.com, @heightsfinance.com, and @cashmoney.ca. Show more Show less

Title: System Engineer
Description: System Engineer Job Summary We are seeking a proactive and technically skilled Support Engineer to join our Internal IT team in the Atlanta office. This role is critical in ensuring the smooth operation of end-user systems, resolving technical issues, and supporting infrastructure stability. You will be the go-to person for hands-on support in the office and collaborate with global IT teams to maintain high service standards. Key Responsibilities Provide first- and second-line support for hardware, software, and network issues. Troubleshoot and resolve incidents related to laptops, printers, docking stations, and peripherals. Maintain and monitor network infrastructure in collaboration with remote teams. Support onboarding/offboarding processes including device setup and user access provisioning. Document solutions and contribute to internal knowledge bases. Participate in IT projects and office improvement initiatives. Maintain a strong security mindset by following best practices in access control, device management, and data protection. Proactively identify and report potential vulnerabilities or risks. Assist with the management and maintenance of IT asset inventory. Provide training and guidance to end-users on best practices and new technologies. Collaborate with vendors to resolve hardware and software issues. Soft Skills Team player with a collaborative mindset and willingness to support colleagues across departments. Self-starter who can work independently and manage multiple priorities with minimal supervision. Strong communicator who can explain technical issues clearly to non-technical users. Problem-solver with the ability to think critically and troubleshoot effectively. You have a good knowledge of Troubleshooting Microsoft Windows 11. Microsoft Windows Server environments. TCP/IP networking. Microsoft 365 ecosystem. Especially Teams, Sharepoint, Onedrive and Outlook. You are familiar with Printers Azure Following up on monitor alerts Stock management Knowledge of the following are an asset: PowerShell Scripting Purview experience Show more Show less

Title: System Engineer
Description: Summary: Seeking a client-focused Systems Engineer to develop and deploy tailored technical solutions for clients in the financial services sector. This role involves designing scalable, repeatable infrastructure and cloud solutions while collaborating closely with internal teams and clients to ensure delivery excellence. Responsibilities: Manage technical project tasks, resolve issues, and perform troubleshooting for client environments. Serve as a client-facing engineer with occasional on-site visits. Configure and troubleshoot servers, networks, and cloud services. Lead and manage small to medium-sized technical projects. Participate in scoping and planning calls, providing expert technical guidance. Contribute to team goals by achieving personal KPIs. Produce clear documentation for internal processes and client-facing guides. Participate in on-call rotation and occasional evening shifts or remote work. Requirements: 2–3 years of experience in a systems engineering or similar technical role. Proven track record with infrastructure implementation and support. Strong experience configuring Windows Servers and Microsoft technologies. Solid networking knowledge (firewalls, switches, TCP/IP, and protocols). Hands-on experience with public cloud platforms, especially Azure. Industry certifications preferred (e.g., Azure Expert, MCSE, VCP, CCP). Previous experience working with or for a Managed Services Provider is a plus. If this would be of interest, apply now! Show more Show less

Title: Level Iv Systems Engineer
Description: We're Hiring: Level IV Systems Engineer Location: Remote with periodic onsite visits (Chicago area) | Type: Full-Time Are you a seasoned IT professional with deep knowledge of network infrastructure, server management, and cloud transitions? Do you thrive on designing, maintaining, and improving complex systems that support small and mid-sized businesses across the country? Are you looking to join a supportive, skilled, and growing team? Syscon, Inc. , established in 1986, provides technology solutions and IT support services to small and medium-sized businesses throughout the U.S., with a strong emphasis on the construction industry. At Syscon, we care deeply about our clients—and about each other. We foster a culture where our company, employees, and clients grow and succeed together. As a successful member of our Syscon team, YOU: Take initiative, embrace feedback, and grow from experience Show confidence without ego and pride in doing excellent work Tackle technical issues creatively and thoroughly, with the end-user in mind Communicate clearly with clients, teammates, and leadership Collaborate with your team to share knowledge and contribute ideas Own your time, tasks, and outcomes—with professionalism and integrity Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with high expectations and strong support We believe you will thrive in the Level IV Systems Engineer role if you possess: 6+ years of experience as a senior or Level IV IT technician Strong background in Microsoft Windows Server (2012 R2 to 2019), including troubleshooting, patching, backups, and configuration Experience working for an Outsourced IT company or Managed Services Provider (MSP) Familiarity with backup solutions such as Datto BDR, Solarwinds, and best-practice retention and monitoring strategies Hands-on experience with VMware ESXi, vSphere, V-Center, and server provisioning Knowledge of SonicWall firewalls and VPN configuration and troubleshooting Solid grasp of LAN/WAN fundamentals, network segmentation, and Wi-Fi architecture (HP Aruba experience is a plus) Experience onboarding and managing Microsoft 365 accounts, as well as architecting SharePoint migrations and Exchange to M365 transitions Exposure to Azure environments, including tenant migrations and administration Familiarity with RMM tools such as N-Able/N-Central, and remote access tools like Take Control, Remote Desktop, or LogMeIn Rescue Experience supporting HP servers, switches, and end-user hardware As our Level IV Systems Engineer, your responsibilities will include: Maintaining our hosting infrastructure (ESXi, Datto, SonicWall HA firewalls, switches, and MSAs) Supporting remote and on-premise client environments across the U.S Onboarding, maintaining, and supporting Microsoft 365 accounts, backups, and SharePoint transitions Performing client migrations from Hosted Exchange and on-prem systems to M365 and Azure Providing remote and on-site support, upgrades, and assessments for client infrastructure Monitoring backups and infrastructure health using N-Central and Solarwinds Participating in team meetings, Daily Stand Ups, and network design planning Communicating with the Customer Support desk and clients to update status and document resolutions Maintaining accurate and thorough documentation in our ticketing system, including time worked, steps taken, and outcomes Protecting client confidentiality and meeting project timelines Skills & Competencies for Success in This Role: Expert-level troubleshooting skills and diagnostic ability Strong organizational and time management abilities Excellent written and verbal communication—both technical and client-facing Confidence working independently and collaboratively Professionalism, punctuality, and attention to detail Desire to grow within a high-performing team and take ownership of your work Certifications (preferred): Microsoft Certified: Windows Server or Azure VMware Certified Professional SonicWall Network Security certifications Datto Certified Advanced Technician Other related technical certifications Perks & Benefits A place to grow your skills and career Work with a talented, committed, and supportive team Excellent medical, dental, and vision benefits Unlimited PTO Work remotely with occasional on-site client visits Ready to Apply? If this sounds like a great fit, submit your application today. Selected candidates may be contacted for additional questions about their experience. Please, no phone calls regarding this position. Syscon, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace Powered by JazzHR dG7Vx5u6Ro Show more Show less

Title: System Engineer
Description: We are seeking a skilled Systems Engineer to join our IT team. This role will focus on managing and supporting our Microsoft ecosystem, including Office 365, Active Directory (on-prem and Azure AD), and Windows-based infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in system administration, troubleshooting, and supporting enterprise environments. Key Responsibilities: Administer, maintain, and support Microsoft 365 (O365) services, including Exchange Online, SharePoint, Teams, and OneDrive. Manage and maintain Active Directory (AD), Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), Group Policy Objects (GPOs), and domain services. Oversee Windows Server and Windows client environments, ensuring stability, security, and performance. Support identity and access management, including single sign-on (SSO), conditional access, and multi-factor authentication (MFA). Assist in cloud integrations and migrations related to Microsoft technologies. Monitor systems, resolve incidents, and implement improvements to increase reliability and security. Document configurations, processes, and procedures. Collaborate with internal teams and vendors on infrastructure projects and initiatives. Required Skills & Experience: 3+ years of experience in a Systems Engineer or similar role supporting Microsoft technologies. Strong hands-on experience with Office 365 administration. In-depth knowledge of Active Directory and Azure Active Directory. Solid understanding of Windows Server (2016/2019/2022) and Windows 10/11 environments. Experience with PowerShell scripting for automation and administration. Familiarity with security best practices (e.g., MFA, conditional access, role-based access). Ability to troubleshoot complex issues across on-prem and cloud environments. Preferred Qualifications: Certifications such as Microsoft 365 Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator Associate, Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate, or MCSA / MCSE Show more Show less

Title: Systems Engineer
Description: Our Mission At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are. Who We Are We take our mission of protecting the digital way of life seriously. We are relentless in protecting our customers and we believe that the unique ideas of every member of our team contributes to our collective success. Our values were crowdsourced by employees and are brought to life through each of us everyday - from disruptive innovation and collaboration, to execution. From showing up for each other with integrity to creating an environment where we all feel included. As a member of our team, you will be shaping the future of cybersecurity. We work fast, value ongoing learning, and we respect each employee as a unique individual. Knowing we all have different needs, our development and personal wellbeing programs are designed to give you choice in how you are supported. This includes our FLEXBenefits wellbeing spending account with over 1,000 eligible items selected by employees, our mental and financial health resources, and our personalized learning opportunities - just to name a few! Job Description Your Career The District Systems Engineer, Commercial, is a vital part of our sales team, serving as a trusted technical advisor to customers and helping them secure their businesses with Palo Alto Networks solutions. You will provide pre-sales technical support to our commercial sales teams, aligning security solutions with customer needs and ensuring successful deployments that drive adoption and business value. As a District Systems Engineer, you will work with customers to understand their security challenges, architect solutions that address those challenges, and demonstrate the value of Palo Alto Networks' comprehensive cybersecurity platform. You will be responsible for driving technical wins and ensuring the continued satisfaction of our customers in the commercial sector. Your Impact Role Curiosity and problem-solving drive the District Systems Engineer role, and you thrive on helping customers secure their environments with innovative solutions. You define your impact by: Partnering with sales teams to meet and exceed sales quotas by building and implementing strategic technical account plans Positioning, demonstrating, and designing security architectures across the Palo Alto Networks portfolio based on customer business needs and architecting complex environments, including network security, security operations, and cloud security. Driving customer adoption of the Palo Alto Networks security platform by helping customers achieve enhanced security, operational efficiency, and business flexibility Conducting technical discovery to understand customer requirements and aligning solutions to their specific needs Leading proof-of-concept (PoC) engagements, technical workshops, and product demonstrations to showcase the capabilities of our security platform Collaborating with Professional Services, Customer Success, and Specialist teams to ensure seamless implementation and adoption of solutions Effectively communicating complex security concepts to a variety of stakeholders, from technical practitioners to executive leadership Orchestrating supporting resources (Specialists, Channel Partners, Customer Support) to drive a unified strategy for customer success Promoting end-to-end security solutions, including Palo Alto Networks and partner professional services, to maximize customer security posture and business value Staying ahead of industry trends, competitive landscapes, and emerging security threats to position Palo Alto Networks as the cybersecurity leader Continuously investing in personal development to enhance technical expertise and professional skills while actively contributing to the District Systems Engineer community and industry events Demonstrating diversity in technical knowledge across SOC, Cloud, Networking, and NetSec, with an emphasis on SOC and Cloud, to drive cross-training and develop platform expertise across the team Becoming a technical leader with the desire to grow into a Palo Alto Networks portfolio architect, gaining expertise from NGFW to SASE, SOC, Cloud, and Unit 42 consulting services Balancing technical acumen with strategic thinking—acting as one part technical architect and one part CTO Building and maintaining strong relationships while demonstrating strong consulting skills Understanding the competitive landscape deeply, at least in your area of specialty Designing and architecting large, complex environments, leveraging expertise in your technical domain Developing strong business acumen with near-term potential to grow into CTO/CIO/CISO-level leadership Willingness to travel up to 50% within the assigned district Serving as a role model and mentor for inside Systems Engineers Qualifications Your Experience 6+ years of experience in pre-sales, sales engineering, or a similar technical role Strong understanding of data networking, security architectures, and modern cloud computing environments Experience delivering cybersecurity solutions that solve complex technical challenges and align with customer business initiatives Ability to influence and gain buy-in from key stakeholders, whether in customer-facing or internal engagements Strong technical presentation, workshop, and proof-of-concept delivery skills Expertise in designing, implementing, or managing one or more of the following security solutions: Network Security, SASE, SaaS, CNAPP, or SOC Transformation Technologies Experience collaborating with Customer Support teams to ensure successful implementation and adoption of security solutions Background in complex sales cycles involving multiple decision-makers and multi-product solutions is preferred Field sales position requiring travel for in-person customer engagements (please discuss specifics with the recruiter). Additional Information The Team Our District Systems Engineers work closely with customers across the commercial sector to secure their digital environments. We educate, inspire, and empower organizations to transform their security architectures and adopt the most advanced cybersecurity solutions available today. You will be supported by industry-leading tools, systems, and a team dedicated to your success. At Palo Alto Networks, collaboration is at the heart of what we do. Everyone is committed to helping each other succeed, whether in solutions selling, learning, or professional development. Our District Systems Engineering community is driven by the mission to be our customers’ cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting their digital way of life. For candidates who receive an offer at the posted level, the starting base salary + commission target (for sales/commissioned roles) is expected to be between $198000/YR - $273000/YR. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here. Title: Systems Engineer
Description: Reporting to the VP, IT Infrastructure, this position is responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining existing systems and ensuring that systems remain available and secure. The position monitors the stability, integrity and efficiency of the systems environment and provides technical expertise that supports critical business functions. The role will continuously monitor and review solutions that will enhance the system to meet and exceed business needs. The role will develop processes and procedures to manage the server environment, including management and improvement of the Business Continuity Plan and Disaster Recovery for the server environment to ensure the server system environment meets the criteria for internal and external audits and inspections. The position partners closely with internal teams and external vendors in a cooperative environment to resolve issues and provide solutions. The Systems Engineer will act as a liaison between IT and internal stakeholders to ensure systems align with current and future business objectives. What you will do for Fay: Participate in architectural reviews and contribute to overall system architecture strategy Design, plan, and implement scalable, reliable, and maintainable solutions to drive innovation and efficiency Manage and implement recovery plans and solutions in the server environment to ensure data integrity and business continuity Continuously evaluate and optimize system performance, capacity, and reliability Propose and Implement solutions to enhance system efficiency and scalability Analyze business needs and recommend technical solutions that align with current and future business objectives Partner with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate them into system solutions Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve complex support issues Provide efficient deployment of systems and partner with internal technical teams to ensure a seamless user experience Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve system issues swiftly and efficiency Maintain comprehensive documentation of system design, configurations, and operational procedures Prepare regular reports on system health and performance metrics. Participate in hardware and software evaluations Maintain current knowledge of industry trends, new technologies, and best practices Recommend industry best practices regarding all items that are owned by the team Partner with internal stakeholders at all organizational levels to ensure project deliverables are met efficiently and on time Develop domain knowledge of Fay’s business to include an understanding of organizational objectives Maintain broad influence through ongoing development of relationships across the organization Ensure compliance with Fay’s policies, processes, and practices. Successfully complete all department and company-required training Model Fay’s Values, Operating Principles, ethical standards, professionalism, and code of conduct Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned What you will bring to Fay: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field required Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE) or equivalent experience 3+ years implementing large-scale infrastructure initiatives 3+ years’ experience with Windows Server and Active Directory 3+ years of experience in providing Level 2/Level 3 operations support for a Windows-based infrastructure 2+ years’ experience with VMware vSphere 2+ years’ experience with Windows Active Directory including implementation 2+ years’ experience managing DNS/DHCP 2+ years’ experience managing Group Policies 2+ years’ experience using PowerShell-based scripting Visio and diagramming experience Strong understanding of networking for storage architectures; experience in iSCSI, NFS, FC protocols Strong Understanding of networking and troubleshooting including TCP/IP, DNS, and DHCP Application support experience with Microsoft Windows Server, VMware Horizon View; thin-client technologies and Terminal Services, Azure Virtual Desktop, iSCSI Storage, Fax and Print Servers Working knowledge of VMWare 6.0+ including implementation Working knowledge of connecting and managing cloud environments, primarily Microsoft Azure Experience in all Windows-based OS’s (Microsoft 2008 & 2012 Server Operating System, Microsoft Windows Operating Systems) with an understanding of Microsoft Exchange applicationsProficient in the Microsoft M365 suite Experience in the financial services or mortgage industry preferred Ability to analyze and interpret data to identify opportunities and propose solutions Strong analytical skills across a range of server technologies Strong problem-solving skills; ability to develop creative solutions to complex business problems. Strong communication and collaboration skills; ability to work effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders Strong verbal and written communication skills Strong project management skills Strong attention to detail; strong compliance orientation; high quality of work product Ability to prioritize; effective time management Strong interpersonal skills Collaborative work style; high team-orientation Open to change; agile; high learning agility Self-directed; ability to proactively ask questions and surface issues/ concerns Professional maturity, integrity, ability to maintain confidential data and information Strong business acumen; strong fiscal and technical aptitude Strong skills in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Equity and Inclusion are embedded into our way of working at Fay. We believe that the best ideas come from having a team that is diverse in backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We strive to ensure each of our employees feels valued, respected and included and is presented with equal opportunities to be successful here at Fay. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. The Fay Group and affiliated companies participate in E-Verify. For more information go to www.dhs.gov/E-Verify. Title: System Engineer
Description: We are seeking an experienced Systems Engineer with a strong background in VMware virtualization technologies and Windows server environments. The ideal candidate will be pivotal in designing, deploying, managing, and optimizing our IT infrastructure. This is a hands-on technical role, where you'll ensure high availability, scalability, and security of critical systems. Key Responsibilities : Design, implement, and maintain VMware infrastructure including ESXi hosts, vCenter servers, and related components. Administer and troubleshoot Windows Server environments, ensuring stability and performance across physical and virtual servers. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deploy new infrastructure, services, and software solutions. Monitor system performance, identify bottlenecks, and implement optimization strategies for both VMware and Windows systems. Automate routine tasks and enhance system performance through scripting (PowerShell, batch, etc.). Manage server configurations, backups, patch management, and disaster recovery planning. Provide technical support for VMware and Windows-related issues, resolving incidents in a timely manner. Perform system upgrades and patches to maintain security and compliance standards. Evaluate, recommend, and implement new technologies to improve operational efficiency and performance. Create and maintain system documentation, including architectural diagrams, procedures, and recovery plans. Provide on-call support for critical systems during off-hours when necessary. Qualifications : Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, or equivalent work experience. Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience with VMware technologies (vSphere, vCenter, ESXi). Solid experience managing Windows Server environments (2008/2012/2016/2019/2022). Strong understanding of virtualization, server infrastructure, and storage solutions. Proficiency in PowerShell scripting or similar automation tools. Experience with Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, and other critical server services. Familiarity with backup, monitoring, and security tools for VMware and Windows environments. Knowledge of disaster recovery strategies and high availability configurations. Strong troubleshooting skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Relevant certifications (VCP, MCSE, or equivalent) are a plus. Preferred Skills : Familiarity with cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, etc.) and hybrid cloud deployments. Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes). Experience with networking concepts and configurations (firewalls, VLANs, VPNs). Show more Show less

Title: Systems Engineer (5240)
Description: This position requires an active TS/SCI security clearance in order to be considered; clearance sponsorship is not available. As a Systems Engineer, you’ll collaborate with other engineers to define system requirements, architecture, and design, with the goal to make an impact across the federal government. In supporting the program, you will be required to work 5 days/ per week onsite in the client's Washington, DC location. What you’ll do: Collaborate with other engineers to define system requirements, architecture, and design Collaborate closely with key stakeholder partners and IT team to evaluate customer requests for new systems, applications, product standards, and services. Work on the core platform to create and optimize all functions needed to establish a strong platform infrastructure. Perform risk assessments and develop mitigation strategies and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations. Analyze and validate system designs against requirements and specifications. What you’ll need to succeed: 8-10 years of experience as a Systems Engineer provisioning, installing, and supporting on-premise mission critical systems Experience maintaining and managing a on-premise VMWare infrastructure In-depth experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC), containerization, Kubernetes, Ubuntu, and CI/CD Automation Experience working in a DevSecOps environment Ability to work well on a team as well as individually Ability to think out of the box to help with troubleshooting issues and providing innovative solutions that fit customers’ needs Ability to establish and maintain a high level of client trust and confidence with your skills A Bachelor's Degree Active TS//SCI clearance What will make you stand out: Experience with system monitoring tools such as SolarWinds, Grafana, and Prometheus Expertise with container orchestration tools (Rancher, OpenShift, etc.) Experience hardening and securing containers Previous experience with commercial cloud (e.g., AWS, Azure) Passion for learning new development concepts, methodologies, and technologies Like we said, we are big fans of our people. That’s why we offer a generous benefits package, professional growth, and valuable time to recharge. Learn more about our company culture code and benefits. Plus, check out our accolades. What we want you to know: In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire. Title: It Systems Engineer, Mission Systems
Description: SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars. IT SYSTEMS ENGINEER, MISSION SYSTEMS As a Systems Engineer in the SpaceX IT organization, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the reliability, scalability, and performance of our Launch Operations infrastructure. Your contributions will provide SpaceX’s IT organization with the tools necessary to exceed the ever-increasing demands associated with a continuously increasing launch cadence and the rapid development of launch vehicles and infrastructure. This role requires excellent technical proficiency, ingenuity, flexibility and the propensity to flourish in a fast-paced and challenging environment. Responsibilities Design, implement, and maintain highly available and resilient systems for launch operations, including mission-critical systems and software, data pipelines, and network infrastructure. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to distill requirements and design effective IT solutions that support the entire launch lifecycle from pre-flight preparations to post-launch analysis and recovery operations. Develop automation tools and scripts to streamline deployment, administration, monitoring, and incident response processes, leveraging technologies such as infrastructure as code frameworks (Ansible, Terraform, Puppet), containerization (Kubernetes, OpenShift), and GitOps source control platforms. Implement robust monitoring and alerting solutions to proactively detect and mitigate issues before they impact operations. Lead incident response efforts, coordinating with multi-disciplinary teams to troubleshoot and resolve issues promptly as well as conducting post-mortem analysis to determine root causes and implementing corrective actions to prevent recurrence. Collaborate with information security teams to ensure security and compliance of our systems, implementing best practices for data protection, access control, and regulatory compliance. Create and maintain comprehensive documentation, runbooks, and knowledge base articles to facilitate knowledge sharing and enable other team members to troubleshoot and resolve issues independently. Provide coaching and mentorship to other members of the SpaceX team, fostering team cohesion, knowledge redundancy and professional growth. Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, math, physics, information systems, or other engineering discipline and 3+ years of experience in IT administration, engineering, or site reliability engineering; OR 5+ years of experience in IT administration, engineering, or site reliability engineering in lieu of a degree Preferred Skills And Experience Proficient in programming/scripting languages such as Python, Go, Bash or PowerShell Strong understanding of Windows or Linux server OS administration concepts, best practices and configuration management tools Experience administering networking technologies such as switches, routers and firewalls Expertise in source code and version control tools Experience working in a mission-critical environment preferably within the aerospace or defense sectors Ability to create and maintain detailed technical documentation and operational runbooks Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders Ability to independently and effectively manage and communicate the status of projects in an extremely fast paced and constantly changing environment Analytical mindset with excellent problem-solving abilities and a proactive approach to recognizing and overcoming technical challenges Additional Requirements Willing to work extended hours or weekends as necessary Ability to provide 24x7 on-call support in emergency situations Recurring travel, including air travel and occasional extended time at sea, is required for operational and training purposes Ability to pass Air Force background check for Cape Canaveral Itar Requirements To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C. 1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C. 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here. SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status. Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX’s Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should reach out to EEOCompliance@spacex.com . Title: System Engineer
Description: The Server R&D Team focuses on the research and development of server hardware in the fields of computing, storage, heterogeneous computing, etc., software development, and the provision and delivery of relevant business solutions. Heterogeneous Hardware and Systems, which belongs to the Heterogeneous Computing Software and Hardware Integration Team under the Server R&D Team, is committed to the introduction of heterogeneous computing components, the planning of corresponding heterogeneous computing infrastructure, and the business delivery of Kunlun software-hardware integration for heterogeneous workloads. It is also responsible for the business requirements and solutions of the Group, Lingjun, and EGS. Sinian team focuses on heterogeneous compute and software-hardware cooperative technologies. We have worked on a unified heterogeneity-aware lowering and optimization platform, accelerating applications on various heterogeneous hardware. Our goal is to unleash the hardware computing power and deploy applications for improving portability, performance, and utilization. Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to: 1. Installation, configuration and bring-up of vendor heterogeneous computing hardware 2. Providing operational support for prototype hardware and software system including validation and troubleshooting 3. Troubleshoot and resolve any system-related issues arising during heterogeneous computing and deployment 4. Performance analysis, profiling and benchmarking of heterogeneous computing workloads running on system 5. Collaborate with production team to distill the requirements 6. Independently solving complex technical and logistical problems in a fast-paced environment Minimum qualification: 1. BS, MS, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field; 2. At least 3-5 years industry experience or relevant experience; 3. Experience with heterogeneous hardware architectures and hardware accelerators; 4. Experience in heterogeneous computing frameworks and toolsets; 5. Ability to work independently, good communication and strong interpersonal skills; 6. Reliability and self-motivation in a dynamic product-oriented team; Preferred qualification: 1. Knowledge of heterogeneous hardware architecture; 2. Experience in large scale computing distributed training process; 3. Knowledge of heterogeneous computing algorithm and architecture; The pay range for this position at commencement of employment is expected to be between $168,000/year and $276,000/year. However, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors. Title: Systems Engineer I - Remote Position

Title: Senior It Systems Engineer, Ops
Description: At GFiber, we believe that great internet has the power to drive innovation, strengthen communities, enable the impossible, and do all the everyday things that make all of our world go round. And the job of creating better internet is never done - so we’re growing! Our team is committed to building a place where people who want to make a difference can grow their careers and find their spot to belong. GFiber is an Alphabet company that brings Google Fiber and Google Fiber Webpass internet services to homes and businesses across the United States. Our teams are expanding as we connect more cities and people to exceptional internet. The application window will be open until at least July 18, 2025 . This opportunity will remain online based on business needs which may be before or after the specified date. At GFiber, our Information Systems and Technology plays a crucial role in enhancing employee productivity and efficiency across all departments. We are dedicated to delivering quality support while fostering a strong business partnership and ensuring seamless project deliverables. Together, we focus on delivering innovative solutions that empower our colleagues and drive the organization forward. Role Description As a Senior IT Systems Engineer, in the IT Corp team, your role is pivotal in ensuring smooth operations and comprehensive support for cross-functional teams within GFiber. You'll drive efficiency by automating processes and leveraging your technical support expertise, strategic mindset, and leadership abilities to implement IT solutions across our expanding organization. In this role, you'll: Foster strong relationships with cross-functional teams to deeply understand their business processes and IT needs. Diagnose and troubleshoot network and software issues promptly, ensuring minimal disruption to operations. Resolve complex hardware, software, and networking challenges efficiently to maintain high availability. Proactively identify opportunities for IT solutions that streamline operations and enhance productivity. Collaborate with stakeholders to implement scalable IT systems and infrastructure solutions. At a minimum we'd like you to have: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field; or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience as a Systems Engineer in a Corporate IT environment. Experience implementing and managing Identity and Access Management including Single Sign-On, multi-factor authentication, role-based access control, and identity lifecycle management in Okta. Experience implementing workflow automations through Okta Workflow. Experience implementing system integrations through API’s, webhook, and pre-built connectors. It's preferred if you have: 8 years of experience as a Systems Engineer in a Corporate IT environment. Experience with scripting languages (Python, Javascript, Powershell, etc.) to deploy advanced system integrations. Experience in managing operating systems (e.g., Windows, ChromeOS, MacOS). Experience with device management solutions (e.g., Kandji, Intune, Workspace). Experience managing multiple identity management solutions (e.g., Okta, Entra ID). Experience with data manipulation and transformation between systems including JSON and various data types. The US base salary range for this full-time position is between $136,000 - $198,000 + bonus + cash award + benefits. As pay varies by location, your recruiter will share more about the specific salary range for your targeted location during the hiring process. Title: System Engineer
Description: Are you ready to make a difference in the world of consumer finance? At Attain Finance, we bring over 50 years of expertise in providing credit solutions across the U.S. and Canada. Our deep roots in the financial industry have empowered us to develop convenient, easily accessible financial services that meet our customers' growing needs. Join a leading consumer credit lender that thrives on innovation and collaboration, where your contributions are truly valued. Our portfolio includes distinguished brands like Cash Money®, LendDirect®, Heights Finance, Southern Finance, Covington Credit, Quick Credit, and First Heritage Credit. Each brand is constantly evolving to better serve our customers. Be part of a dynamic team that is shaping the future of consumer finance. Apply today and take the next step in your career with Attain Finance! Responsibilities We are seeking a proactive and innovative Senior System Engineer who excels at diagnosing and solving issues. You will excel in this role if you are a self-starter passionate about AWS/Azure and Windows server technologies. A main focus will be on stability and performance while modernizing our legacy enterprise systems. A deep understanding of our business needs and a commitment to enhancing processes for improved system stability and efficiency are essential. What you will be doing: Installing, configuring, and maintaining Windows servers and workstations, w ith a focus on automation Developing and implementing automation scripts and tools to streamline system management tasks M anaging identity and permissions securely in Active Directory, AWS, and Entra ID Monitoring system performance, identifying issues, and implementing solutions to ensure optimal operation with a strong understanding of Client-Server network communication issues Ensuring systems are secure and compliant with company policies and industry standards Creating and maintaining detailed documentation and diagrams of system configurations, procedures, and automation scripts Working closely with other IT teams to integrate systems and support business operations Including DNS management in AWS, Azure, and legacy Active Directory for the purposes of stability, troubleshooting, and providing improvement recommendations Qualifications What you should have: Proficiency in Windows Server, Active Directory, and Entra ID is essential Strong scripting skills in PowerShell are required ; experience with other automation tools is a plus Knowledge of network protocols and services (DNS, DHCP, TCP/IP) Familiarity with Azure and AWS in regard to server deployment and automation, including experience with services such as EC2, S3, RDS, and Azure VMs Excellent problem-solving skills demonstrated through successful resolution of complex system issues in a fast paced environment Strong communication skills, including experience collaborating with cross-functional teams to achieve project goals. Base Salary: $80,000 - $110,000 The base salary range represents the low and high end of the anticipated salary range for this position based on the U.S. average. The actual base salary offered for this full-time position will be determined by various factors, including but not limited to, location, skills, knowledge, competencies, and experience. All full-time salaried employees are eligible for the following benefits, starting on day one: Flexible Paid Time Off Program, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Disability, and other voluntary coverages. You will also be eligible to participate in our 401k program, starting on the first of the month following 30 days of employment with a company match. This employer participates in E-Verify for US-based hires. # AttainFinance EEO Statement Attain Finance Supports Equal Employment Opportunity. CURO (dba Cash Money®, LendDirect®, Heights Finance, Southern Finance, Covington Credit, Quick Credit, and First Heritage Credit) is committed to a policy of providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified employees and applicants. This commitment is reflected in all aspects of our daily operations. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, or genetic information in any personnel practice, including recruitment, hiring, training, compensation, promotion, and discipline. Additionally, we do not discriminate based on any other characteristic protected by applicable state/provincial or local law where a particular employee works. In addition, it is the policy of Attain Finance to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified employees who have protected disabilities to the extent required by federal law and any state/provincial law where a particular employee works. Notice to Attain Finance job applicants: Attain Finance will never ask for your personal banking information, transfer of funds, a credit card, or for you to purchase any equipment to process a job application or for training. Authorized Attain Finance representatives' email addresses will end in @attainfinace.com, @curo.com, @first-heritage.com, @heightsfinance.com, and @cashmoney.ca. Show more Show less

Title: System Engineer
Description: System Engineer Job Summary We are seeking a proactive and technically skilled Support Engineer to join our Internal IT team in the Atlanta office. This role is critical in ensuring the smooth operation of end-user systems, resolving technical issues, and supporting infrastructure stability. You will be the go-to person for hands-on support in the office and collaborate with global IT teams to maintain high service standards. Key Responsibilities Provide first- and second-line support for hardware, software, and network issues. Troubleshoot and resolve incidents related to laptops, printers, docking stations, and peripherals. Maintain and monitor network infrastructure in collaboration with remote teams. Support onboarding/offboarding processes including device setup and user access provisioning. Document solutions and contribute to internal knowledge bases. Participate in IT projects and office improvement initiatives. Maintain a strong security mindset by following best practices in access control, device management, and data protection. Proactively identify and report potential vulnerabilities or risks. Assist with the management and maintenance of IT asset inventory. Provide training and guidance to end-users on best practices and new technologies. Collaborate with vendors to resolve hardware and software issues. Soft Skills Team player with a collaborative mindset and willingness to support colleagues across departments. Self-starter who can work independently and manage multiple priorities with minimal supervision. Strong communicator who can explain technical issues clearly to non-technical users. Problem-solver with the ability to think critically and troubleshoot effectively. You have a good knowledge of Troubleshooting Microsoft Windows 11. Microsoft Windows Server environments. TCP/IP networking. Microsoft 365 ecosystem. Especially Teams, Sharepoint, Onedrive and Outlook. You are familiar with Printers Azure Following up on monitor alerts Stock management Knowledge of the following are an asset: PowerShell Scripting Purview experience Show more Show less

Title: System Engineer
Description: Summary: Seeking a client-focused Systems Engineer to develop and deploy tailored technical solutions for clients in the financial services sector. This role involves designing scalable, repeatable infrastructure and cloud solutions while collaborating closely with internal teams and clients to ensure delivery excellence. Responsibilities: Manage technical project tasks, resolve issues, and perform troubleshooting for client environments. Serve as a client-facing engineer with occasional on-site visits. Configure and troubleshoot servers, networks, and cloud services. Lead and manage small to medium-sized technical projects. Participate in scoping and planning calls, providing expert technical guidance. Contribute to team goals by achieving personal KPIs. Produce clear documentation for internal processes and client-facing guides. Participate in on-call rotation and occasional evening shifts or remote work. Requirements: 2–3 years of experience in a systems engineering or similar technical role. Proven track record with infrastructure implementation and support. Strong experience configuring Windows Servers and Microsoft technologies. Solid networking knowledge (firewalls, switches, TCP/IP, and protocols). Hands-on experience with public cloud platforms, especially Azure. Industry certifications preferred (e.g., Azure Expert, MCSE, VCP, CCP). Previous experience working with or for a Managed Services Provider is a plus. If this would be of interest, apply now! Show more Show less

Title: Level Iv Systems Engineer
Description: We're Hiring: Level IV Systems Engineer Location: Remote with periodic onsite visits (Chicago area) | Type: Full-Time Are you a seasoned IT professional with deep knowledge of network infrastructure, server management, and cloud transitions? Do you thrive on designing, maintaining, and improving complex systems that support small and mid-sized businesses across the country? Are you looking to join a supportive, skilled, and growing team? Syscon, Inc. , established in 1986, provides technology solutions and IT support services to small and medium-sized businesses throughout the U.S., with a strong emphasis on the construction industry. At Syscon, we care deeply about our clients—and about each other. We foster a culture where our company, employees, and clients grow and succeed together. As a successful member of our Syscon team, YOU: Take initiative, embrace feedback, and grow from experience Show confidence without ego and pride in doing excellent work Tackle technical issues creatively and thoroughly, with the end-user in mind Communicate clearly with clients, teammates, and leadership Collaborate with your team to share knowledge and contribute ideas Own your time, tasks, and outcomes—with professionalism and integrity Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with high expectations and strong support We believe you will thrive in the Level IV Systems Engineer role if you possess: 6+ years of experience as a senior or Level IV IT technician Strong background in Microsoft Windows Server (2012 R2 to 2019), including troubleshooting, patching, backups, and configuration Experience working for an Outsourced IT company or Managed Services Provider (MSP) Familiarity with backup solutions such as Datto BDR, Solarwinds, and best-practice retention and monitoring strategies Hands-on experience with VMware ESXi, vSphere, V-Center, and server provisioning Knowledge of SonicWall firewalls and VPN configuration and troubleshooting Solid grasp of LAN/WAN fundamentals, network segmentation, and Wi-Fi architecture (HP Aruba experience is a plus) Experience onboarding and managing Microsoft 365 accounts, as well as architecting SharePoint migrations and Exchange to M365 transitions Exposure to Azure environments, including tenant migrations and administration Familiarity with RMM tools such as N-Able/N-Central, and remote access tools like Take Control, Remote Desktop, or LogMeIn Rescue Experience supporting HP servers, switches, and end-user hardware As our Level IV Systems Engineer, your responsibilities will include: Maintaining our hosting infrastructure (ESXi, Datto, SonicWall HA firewalls, switches, and MSAs) Supporting remote and on-premise client environments across the U.S Onboarding, maintaining, and supporting Microsoft 365 accounts, backups, and SharePoint transitions Performing client migrations from Hosted Exchange and on-prem systems to M365 and Azure Providing remote and on-site support, upgrades, and assessments for client infrastructure Monitoring backups and infrastructure health using N-Central and Solarwinds Participating in team meetings, Daily Stand Ups, and network design planning Communicating with the Customer Support desk and clients to update status and document resolutions Maintaining accurate and thorough documentation in our ticketing system, including time worked, steps taken, and outcomes Protecting client confidentiality and meeting project timelines Skills & Competencies for Success in This Role: Expert-level troubleshooting skills and diagnostic ability Strong organizational and time management abilities Excellent written and verbal communication—both technical and client-facing Confidence working independently and collaboratively Professionalism, punctuality, and attention to detail Desire to grow within a high-performing team and take ownership of your work Certifications (preferred): Microsoft Certified: Windows Server or Azure VMware Certified Professional SonicWall Network Security certifications Datto Certified Advanced Technician Other related technical certifications Perks & Benefits A place to grow your skills and career Work with a talented, committed, and supportive team Excellent medical, dental, and vision benefits Unlimited PTO Work remotely with occasional on-site client visits Ready to Apply? If this sounds like a great fit, submit your application today. Selected candidates may be contacted for additional questions about their experience. Please, no phone calls regarding this position.
